clinical_study.brief_title: Time Restricted Feeding on Impaired Glucose Regulation(TRIG Trial)
clinical_study.official_title: Study to Evaluate the Effects of Time-Restricted Feeding Regimen in Overweight/Obese Subjects With Impaired Glucose Regulation

lead_sponsor.agency: The First Affiliated Hospital of Xiamen University

clinical_study.source: The First Affiliated Hospital of Xiamen University

brief_summary.textblock: We evaluated the effects of Time-Restricted Feeding (TRF) regimen on Impaired Glucose Regulation (IGR) in comparison with overweight/obese patients receiving standard of care over 12 months.

primary_outcome.measure: Changes in fasting blood glucose levels (mmol/L)

primary_outcome.description: Insulin sensitivity will be assessed by HOMA-IR

primary_outcome.measure: Incidence of regression to normoglycaemia among the studied population

secondary_outcome.description: β cell function will be assessed by HOMA-β

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in serum Low density lipoprotein levels (mmol/L)
Changes in serum total cholesterol levels (mmol/L)

secondary_outcome.description: the incidence of DM among Chinese primary care patients with impaired fasting glucose (including isolated IFG or combined IFG / IGT)

arm_group.description: Participants in this group will focus on time restricted feeding (TRF) in addition to daily calorie restriction.
Participants in this group will focus on standard care with daily reduced calorie diet (RCD)

intervention.description: Participants will receive a diet of 1200-1500kcal/d and be instructed to eat only during a window of 8 hours (Finishing the last meal before 4pm) in the first 3 months. 3 months later,Participants will receive a diet of 1200-1500kcal/d without a restriction of feeding time.
Participants will receive a diet of 1200-1500kcal/d and keep their usual eating pattern.

facility.name: The first affiliated hospital of Xiamen university
